lead_paragraph: On April 4, a strained pectoral muscle kept Mike Hampton from making his first start since 2005 and left the Braves’ bullpen short-handed before the game even began. By the time the Pirates and Braves went into the 10th inning, Atlanta Manager Bobby Cox’s options were limited. He had reliever Chris Resop on the mound but wanted Royce Ring to face the lefty Adam LaRoche. The problem was that Cox wanted Resop to pitch however many innings remained after that.
